body.p: Born on May 23, 1824 near Liberty, Indiana. Married to Mary Richmond Bishop. Graduated from West Point in 1847 and commissioned a brevet second lieutenant in the 2nd Artillery. Resigned in 1853, started Bristol Rifle Works in order to manufacture his invention, the Burnside carbine. Commissioned colonel of 1st Rhode Island Volunteers April 16, 1861. August 6, 1861 appointed brigadier general of U.S. Volunteers. Promoted to major general on March 18, 1862. Accepted command of the Army of the Potomac on November 8, 1862. Assigned command of the Department of the Ohio on March 16, 1863. Resigned on April 15, 1865. Died on September 13, 1881.
